title.rendered: OWC in Wind Energy Network Magazine

content.rendered:
Wind Energy Network magazine recently published an article on Technical Due Diligence by Dr Khalid Kamhawi of Offshore Wind Consultants Ltd.

Click below to read the full article.

excerpt.rendered: Wind Energy Network magazine recently published an article on Technical Due Diligence by Dr Khalid Kamhawi of Offshore Wind Consultants Ltd.

jetpack-related-posts.title: AqualisBraemar provides technical advisory to J.F. Lehman & Company in its acquisition of Global Marine Group
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: The AqualiBraemar Marine team recently provided technical due diligence covering the vessels and ports to J.F. Lehman & Company for its successful acquisition of Global Marine Group, a leading provider of subsea cable maintenance and installation services to the telecommunications, offshore wind (CWind vessels), and utility markets worldwide. The transaction…

img.alt_text: C.S. Sovereign ready for Wikinger job

jetpack-related-posts.title: Energy Global Winter Issue 2020 publishes article by OWC
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: OWC’s APAC director Tom Whittle and Cables expert Daniele Caruso jointly tackle floating wind in the Winter 2020 edition of the Energy Global magazine.

jetpack-related-posts.title: AqualisBraemar opens Taiwan office
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: 11 April 2017 – Marine and offshore engineering consultancy AqualisBraemar, part of Oslo-listed Aqualis ASA, has opened up an office in Taiwan to support local offshore wind and oil and gas developments. The purpose of the office is to promote AqualisBraemar’s marine and engineering services locally, and to support the…

jetpack-related-posts.title: Liftboat launch in China
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: 26 October 2016 – Mekers Offshore Ltd has successfully launched its first in a series of liftboats at Dajin Heavy Industries yard in Jiangsu, China. AqualisBraemar, part of Oslo-listed Aqualis ASA, was last year contracted by Mekers Offshore Ltd to supervise the construction of the Zhejiang-based company’s two new liftboats,…

jetpack-related-posts.title: OWC advises on geohazards for Polish offshore wind
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: OWC has identified significant geohazards that developers should address following a study of the geological conditions of the Polish sector of the Baltic Sea.   “We have identified numerous key potential geohazards such as boulders, shallow gas, geological faults, chalk and lateral variability of the soil conditions with some bedrock…

jetpack-related-posts.title: AqualisBraemar enters Aberdeen
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: 1 June 2015 – International marine and offshore engineering consultancy AqualisBraemar bucks the oil market trend to establish an office in Aberdeen, Scotland. “We know that job cuts currently is a common theme in the oil industry, but we are taking a long-term approach. Entering Aberdeen was the obvious next…
